1. Component: Continuous Wave¶

class optcom.components.cw.CW(name='CW', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], peak_power=[0.001], offset_nu=[0.0], init_phi=[0.0], save=False)¶

A CW pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

peak_power¶

Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

Type

list of float

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \exp\Big[i\big(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c +\nu_{offset})t\big)\Big]\]

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • channels (int) -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda (List[float]) -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • peak_power (List[float]) -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • offset_nu (List[float]) -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • init_phi (List[float]) -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

2. Component: Fiber¶

class optcom.components.fiber.Fiber(name='Fiber', length=1.0, alpha=None, alpha_order=1, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, tau_1=0.0122, tau_2=0.032, f_R=0.245, core_radius=5.0, NA=0.1, nl_approx=True, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, approx_type=1, method='rk4ip', steps=100, medium='sio2', save=False, save_all=False)¶

A non ideal Fiber.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] __________________ [1]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • length (float) -- The length of the fiber. \([km]\)

  • alpha (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order (int) -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order (int) -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma (Union[float, Callable, None]) -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma (float) -- Positive term multiplying the XPM term of the NLSE

  • eta (float) -- Positive term muiltiplying the XPM in other non linear terms of the NLSE

  • T_R (float) -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • tau_1 (float) -- The inverse of vibrational frequency of the fiber core molecules. \([ps]\)

  • tau_2 (float) -- The damping time of vibrations. \([ps]\)

  • f_R (float) -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • core_radius (float) -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • NA (Union[float, Callable]) -- The numerical aperture.

  • nl_approx (bool) -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • ATT (bool) -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP (bool) -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM (bool) -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS (bool) -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • approx_type (int) -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • method (str) -- The solver method type

  • steps (int) -- The number of steps for the solver

  • medium (str) -- The main medium of the fiber.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all (bool) -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

3. Component: Fiber Amplifier¶

class optcom.components.fiber_amplifier.FiberAmplifier(name='Fiber Amplifier', length=1.0, alpha=None, alpha_order=1, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, gain_order=1, sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, tau_1=0.0122, tau_2=0.032, f_R=0.245, nl_approx=True, sigma_a=None, sigma_e=None, n_core=None, n_clad=None, NA=None, temperature=293.15, tau_meta=840.0, N_T=0.063, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=62.5, area_doped=None, eta_s=1.26, eta_p=1.41, R_0=0.0008, R_L=0.0008, signal_width=[1.0], nl_index=None, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, GS=True, approx_type=1, medium='sio2', dopant='yt', method='rk4ip', steps=100, solver_order='following', error=0.01, propagate_pump=False, save=False, save_all=False)¶

A non ideal Fiber Amplifier.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

N_0¶

The population in the ground state.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

N_1¶

The population in the metastable state.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_signal_forward¶

Power of the foward propagating signal for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_signal_backward¶

Power of the backward propagating signal for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_ase_forward¶

Power of the foward propagating ase for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_ase_backward¶

Power of the backward propagating ase for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_pump_forward¶

Power of the foward propagating pump for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

power_pump_backward¶

Power of the backward propagating pump for each channel.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] _____________________ [1]
    /                   \
   /                     \
[2]                       [3]

[0] and [1] : signal and [2] and [3] : pump

Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • length (float) -- The length of the fiber. \([km]\)

  • alpha (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order (int) -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order (int) -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma (Union[float, Callable, None]) -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • gain_order (int) -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account. (from the Rate Equations resolution)

  • eta (float) -- Positive term muiltiplying the XPM in other non linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R (float) -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • tau_1 (float) -- The inverse of vibrational frequency of the fiber core molecules. \([ps]\)

  • tau_2 (float) -- The damping time of vibrations. \([ps]\)

  • f_R (float) -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • nl_approx (bool) -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • sigma_a (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The absorption cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2). \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, varibale must be wavelength. \([nm]\)

  • sigma_e (Union[List[float], Callable, None]) -- The emission cross sections of the signal and the pump (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2). \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, varibale must be wavelength. \([nm]\)

  • n_core (Union[float, List[float], None]) -- The refractive index of the core. If the medium is not recognised by Optcom, at least two elements should be provided out of those three: n_core, n_clad, NA.

  • n_clad (Union[float, List[float], None]) -- The refractive index of the cladding. If the medium is not recognised by Optcom, at least two elements should be provided out of those three: n_core, n_clad, NA.

  • NA (Union[float, List[float], None]) -- The numerical aperture. If the medium is not recognised by Optcom, at least two elements should be provided out of those three: n_core, n_clad, NA.

  • temperature (float) -- The temperature of the medium. \([K]\)

  • tau_meta (float) -- The metastable level lifetime. \([\mu s]\)

  • N_T (float) -- The total doping concentration. \([nm^{-3}]\)

  • core_radius (float) -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius (float) -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • area_doped (Optional[float]) -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\) If None, will be approximated to the core area.

  • eta_s (float) -- The background signal loss. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • eta_p (float) -- The background pump loss. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • R_0 (float) -- The reflectivity at the fiber start.

  • R_L (float) -- The reflectivity at the fiber end.

  • signal_width (List[float]) -- The width of each channel of the signal. \([ps]\)

  • nl_index (Union[float, Callable, None]) -- The non linear index. Used to calculate the non linear parameter. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\)

  • ATT (bool) -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP (bool) -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM (bool) -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS (bool) -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • GS (bool) -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • approx_type (int) -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • medium (str) -- The main medium of the fiber amplifier.

  • dopant (str) -- The doped medium of the fiber amplifier.

  • method (str) -- The solver method type

  • steps (int) -- The number of steps for the solver

  • solver_order (str) -- The order in which to solve RE and NLSE. Can be either "following" or "alternating".

  • error (float) -- The error for convergence criterion of stepper resolution.

  • propagate_pump (bool) -- If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all (bool) -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

4. Component: Fiber Coupler¶

class optcom.components.fiber_coupler.FiberCoupler(name='Fiber Coupler', length=1.0, max_nbr_pass=None, nbr_fibers=2, alpha=None, alpha_order=1, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, kappa=None, sigma=[2.0], sigma_cross=[[0.1]], eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, tau_1=0.0122, tau_2=0.032, f_R=0.245, nl_approx=True, NA=[0.1], ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, ASYM=True, COUP=True, approx_type=1, medium='sio2', c2c_spacing=[[15.0]], core_radius=[5.0], V=[2.0], n_0=[1.0], method='rk4ip', steps=100, save=False, save_all=False, wait=False)¶

A non ideal fiber coupler.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] _______        ______ [2]
           \______/
[1] _______/      \______ [3]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • length (float) -- The length of the coupler. \([km]\)

  • nbr_fibers (int) -- The number of fibers in the coupler.

  • alpha (Union[List[List[float]], List[Callable], None]) -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order (int) -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta (Union[List[List[float]], List[Callable], None]) -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order (int) -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma (Union[List[float], List[Callable], None]) -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • kappa (Optional[List[List[List[float]]]]) -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • sigma (List[float]) -- Positive term multiplying the XPM term of the NLSE.

  • sigma_cross (List[List[float]]) -- Positive term multiplying the XPM term of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • eta (float) -- Positive term muiltiplying the XPM in other non linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R (float) -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • tau_1 (float) -- The inverse of vibrational frequency of the fiber core molecules. \([ps]\)

  • tau_2 (float) -- The damping time of vibrations. \([ps]\)

  • f_R (float) -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • NA (Union[List[float], List[Callable]]) -- The numerical aperture.

  • nl_approx (bool) -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • ATT (bool) -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP (bool) -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM (bool) -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM (bool) -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS (bool) -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • ASYM (bool) -- If True, trigger the asymmetry effects between cores.

  • COUP (bool) -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • approx_type (int) -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • medium (str) -- The main medium of the fiber.

  • c2c_spacing (List[List[float]]) -- The center to center distance between two cores. \([\mu m]\)

  • core_radius (List[float]) -- The core radius. \([\mu m]\)

  • V (List[float]) -- The fiber parameter.

  • n_0 (List[float]) -- The refractive index outside of the waveguides.

  • method (str) -- The solver method type

  • steps (int) -- The number of steps for the solver

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all (bool) -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

  • wait (bool) -- If True, wait for another pulse in the anolog port [0 <-> 1, and 2 <-> 3] to launch the simulation.

5. Component: Gaussian¶

class optcom.components.gaussian.Gaussian(name='Gaussian', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], position=[0.5], width=[10.0], peak_power=[0.001], bit_rate=[0.0], offset_nu=[0.0], order=[1], chirp=[0.0], init_phi=[0.0], save=False)¶

A gaussian pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

position¶

Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

Type

list of float

width¶

Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

Type

list of float

peak_power¶

Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

Type

list of float

bit_rate¶

Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

order¶

The order of the super gaussian pulse.

Type

list of int

chirp¶

The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \exp\bigg[-\frac{1+iC}{2} \bigg(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\bigg)^{2m} + i\big(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c + \nu_{offset})t\big)\bigg]\]

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • channels (int) -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda (List[float]) -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • position (List[float]) -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width (List[float]) -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • peak_power (List[float]) -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • bit_rate (List[float]) -- Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • offset_nu (List[float]) -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • order (List[int]) -- The order of the super gaussian pulse.

  • chirp (List[float]) -- The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

  • init_phi (List[float]) -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

7. Component: Ideal Combiner¶

class optcom.components.ideal_combiner.IdealCombiner(name='Ideal Combiner', arms=2, combine=False, ratios=None, wait=True, save=False)¶

An ideal Combiner.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

arms¶

The number of input arms.

Type

int

ratios¶

A list with the combining ratios of the corresponding index-number port.

Type

list of float

Notes

Component diagram:

[0]   _________
[1]   __________\
[2]   ___________\_______ [n]
[3]   ___________/
    ...
[n-1] _________/
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • arms (int) -- The number of input arms.

  • combine (bool) -- If False, propagate all the fields without changing them in the last port. Otherwise, add values of channels with same center angular frequencies and append the others depending on ratios provided, then propagate the resulting field.

  • ratios (Optional[List[float]]) -- A list with the combining ratios of the corresponding index-number port.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

10. Component: Ideal Mach-Zehnder Modulator¶

class optcom.components.ideal_mz.IdealMZ(name='Ideal MZ Modulator', phase_shift=[0.0, 0.0], loss=0.0, ext_ratio=0.0, v_pi=None, v_bias=None, v_mod=None, save=False)¶

An ideal Mach Zehnder Modulator

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

Notes

\[\phi_k(t)= \pi \frac{V_{mod,k}(t)+V_{bias,k}}{V_{\pi,k}} \quad k\in\{1,2\}\]

Component diagram:

          _______
[0] _____/       \______ [1]
         \_______/
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • phase_shift (Union[List[float], List[Callable]]) -- The phase difference induced between the two arms of the MZ. Can be a list of callable with time variable. \([ps]\) (will be ignored if (v_pi and v_bias) or (v_pi and v_mod) are provided)

  • loss (float) -- The loss induced by the MZ. \([dB]\)

  • ext_ratio (float) -- The extinction ratio.

  • v_pi (Optional[List[float]]) -- The half-wave voltage. \([V]\)

  • v_bias (Optional[List[float]]) -- The bias voltage. \([V]\)

  • v_mod (Optional[List[Callable]]) -- The modulation voltage \([V]\). Must be a callable with time variable. \([ps]\)

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

11. Component: Ideal Phase Modulator¶

class optcom.components.ideal_phase_mod.IdealPhaseMod(name='Ideal Phase Modulator', phase_shift=3.141592653589793, phase=None, save=False)¶

An ideal phase Modulator

save¶

Type

Type

Notes

Parameters

  • phase_shift (Union[float, Callable]) -- The phase_shift induced by the modulator. Can be a callable with time variable. \([ps]\)

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

12. Component: Sech¶

class optcom.components.sech.Sech(name='Sech', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], position=[0.5], width=[10.0], peak_power=[0.001], bit_rate=[0.0], offset_nu=[0.0], chirp=[0.0], init_phi=[0.0], save=False)¶

An hyperbolic secant pulse Generator.

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

The number of channels in the field.

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

Type

list of float

width¶

Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

Type

list of float

peak_power¶

Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

Type

list of float

bit_rate¶

Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

chirp¶

The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \sech\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[-\frac{iC}{2}\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}^{2} + i(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c + \nu_{offset})t)\bigg]\]

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • channels (int) -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda (List[float]) -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • position (List[float]) -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width (List[float]) -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • peak_power (List[float]) -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • bit_rate (List[float]) -- Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • offset_nu (List[float]) -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • chirp (List[float]) -- The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

  • init_phi (List[float]) -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

13. Component: Soliton¶

class optcom.components.soliton.Soliton(name='Soliton', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], position=[0.5], width=[10.0], bit_rate=[0.0], offset_nu=[0.0], order=[1], init_phi=[0.0], beta_2=[-18.0], gamma=[1.0], save=False)¶

A soliton pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

Type

bool

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

position¶

Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

Type

list of float

width¶

Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

Type

list of float

bit_rate¶

Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

order¶

The order of the super soliton pulse.

Type

list of int

beta_2¶

The GVD term of the dispersion. (must be negative) \([ps^2\cdot km^{-1}]\)

Type

list of float

gamma¶

The non-linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\)

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} A(0,t) &= \sqrt{P_0}\sech\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c+\nu_{offset})t)\bigg]\\ &= \sqrt{\frac{N_s^2}{\gamma L_D}} \sech\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c+\nu_{offset})t)\bigg]\\ &= \sqrt{-\frac{N_s^2 \beta_2}{\gamma T_0^2}} \sech\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c+\nu_{offset})t)\bigg] \end{split}\end{split}\]

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • channels (int) -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda (List[float]) -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • position (List[float]) -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width (List[float]) -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • bit_rate (List[float]) -- Bit rate (repetition rate) of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • offset_nu (List[float]) -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • order (List[int]) -- The order of the super soliton pulse.

  • init_phi (List[float]) -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • beta_2 (List[float]) -- The GVD term of the dispersion. (must be negative) \([ps^2\cdot km^{-1}]\)

  • gamma (List[float]) -- The non-linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\)

  • save (bool) -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.
